Method Detail

getManager

OWLKnowledgeBaseManager getManager()
Returns:
The manager used by this KB.

getOntologies

java.util.Set<OWLOntology> getOntologies(boolean all)
Return the set of ontologies loaded to this KB with the option to include/exclude imported ones. An ontology ont is considered to be imported if there was no explicit method call to load the ontology, i.e, load(OWLOntology, boolean) or read(URI), but ont was imported by one of the loaded ontologies.

Parameters:
all - If true return all ontologies, otherwise return only the explicitly loaded ones.
Returns:
The set of ontologies.

getOntology

OWLOntology getOntology(java.net.URI uri)
Return the loaded ontology associated with this URI. Returns null if there is no ontology with this URI.

Parameters:
uri - URI of the ontology.
Returns:
Ontology with the given URI, or null if none exists.

createOntology

OWLOntology createOntology(java.net.URI uri)
Create an empty ontology with the given URI (may represent a logical or physical URI). The new ontology will belong to this KB.

Parameters:
uri - Logical URI of the ontology xor the physical URI of the ontology from where it can be loaded. Must not be null.
Returns:
A new and initially empty ontology.

createOntology

OWLOntology createOntology(java.net.URI uri,
                           java.lang.Object model)
Create an empty ontology with the given URI (may represent a logical or physical URI) and an implementation specific data structure (Jena Model). The new ontology will belong to this KB.

Parameters:
uri - Logical URI of the ontology xor the physical URI of the ontology from where it can be loaded. May be null.
model - The implementation specific data structure.
Returns:
A new ontology representing the given model.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - If model is not compatible with the expected implementation specific data structure.

setReasoner

void setReasoner(java.lang.String reasonerName)
Attach a reasoner to this KB using a reasoner name. See OWLFactory.getReasonerNames() for available reasoner names.

For the Jena based implementation available reasoner names are:

  • RDFS
  • Transitive
  • OWL
  • OWLMini
  • OWLMicro
  • Pellet

Parameters:
reasonerName - The name of the reasoner. If null no reasoner will be used at all.

setReasoner

void setReasoner(java.lang.Object reasoner)
Set the reasoner using an implementation specific reasoner object. The exact type of the parameter is different for Jena and OWL-API.

Parameters:
reasoner - The reasoner that should be used for (logic based) inferencing. If null no reasoner will be used at all.

getReasoner

java.lang.Object getReasoner()
Returns:
The reasoner used by this KB, or null if none is attached.

load

OWLOntology load(OWLOntology ontology,
                 boolean withImports)
Load the ontology to the KB. If the ontology is created using another KB a copy will be created before load. The imports will automatically be loaded if the second parameter is true. It is guaranteed that OWLOntology.getKB() on the returned OWLOntology (and any of its import ontologies) will return a reference to this KB.

The ontology will be rejected if it causes this KB to become inconsistent. This requires a reasoner to be attached to this KB (see getReasoner()) and auto consistency to be active (see isAutoConsistency()).

Parameters:
ontology - The ontology to load or null if it was not loaded.
withImports - Whether or not to include imported ontologies.
Returns:
The loaded ontology.

unload

void unload(OWLOntology ontology)
Unload the ontology from the KB. The imports of the ontology will automatically be unloaded if there are no other ontologies importing them. Note that ontologies loaded explicitly using load(OWLOntology, boolean) will not be unloaded. This method does nothing if the ontology is not loaded in this KB.

Parameters:
ontology - A ontology to unload.

unload

void unload(java.net.URI uri)
Unload the ontology from the KB. The imports of the ontology will automatically be unloaded if there are no other ontologies importing them. Note that ontologies loaded explicitly using load(OWLOntology, boolean) will not be unloaded. This method does nothing if the ontology is not loaded in this KB.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of the ontology to unload.

getReader

OWLReader getReader()
Returns:
The reader associated with this KB.

read

OWLOntology read(java.net.URI uri)
                 throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to read an ontology into this KB from the given physical URI. This method delegates to the corresponding method of the associated reader.

In order to load local files you may use kb.read(file.toURI()).

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getQNames

QNameProvider getQNames()
Returns:
Utility class to resolve qualified names in this KB.

isAutoConsistency

boolean isAutoConsistency()
Returns:
true if this KB checks consistency automatically after each ontology is loaded and rejects to load the ontology if it causes inconsistency.

setAutoConsistency

boolean setAutoConsistency(boolean auto)
Set/clear the behavior to check consistency automatically after each ontology is loaded. When auto consistency is turned on an ontology that causes inconsistency will not be loaded. If turned off no consistency check will be done automatically.

Returns:
The previous value.

isAutoTranslate

boolean isAutoTranslate()

setAutoTranslate

boolean setAutoTranslate(boolean auto)

setStrictConversion

boolean setStrictConversion(boolean strict)
Parameters:
strict - Whether to use strict conversion for OWL objects in this KB, that is, any OWL object contained in any ontology part of this KB.
Returns:
The previous value.

isStrictConversion

boolean isStrictConversion()
Returns:
true if strict conversion is used globally for this KB, that is, for all ontologies contained in this KB.

readService

Service readService(java.net.URI uri)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to read an ontology into this KB from the given physical URI and to query for a OWL-S service individual. More precisely, the method searches the ontology resource for a service individual whose URI partially matches the given URI. For instance, if the given URI would be http://mydomain/foo.owl and the ontology contains a service http://mydomain/foo.owl#MyService the method would return this service because both URIs partially match (except for the fragment). If several instances exist it picks one arbitrarily.

This method delegates to the corresponding method of the associated reader.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
OWLReader.read(URI)

readService

Service readService(java.io.Reader in,
                    java.net.URI baseURI)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to read an ontology into this KB from the given Reader and to query for a OWL-S service individual. More precisely, the method searches the ontology resource for a service individual whose URI partially matches the given baseURI. For instance, if the base URI would be http://mydomain/foo.owl and the ontology contains a service http://mydomain/foo.owl#MyService the method would return this service because both URIs partially match (except for the fragment). If several instances exist it picks one arbitrarily.

This method delegates to the corresponding method of the associated reader.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
OWLReader.read(Reader, URI)

readService

Service readService(java.io.InputStream in,
                    java.net.URI baseURI)
                    throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to read an ontology into this KB from the given InputStream and to query for an OWL-S service individual. More precisely, the method searches the ontology resource for a service individual whose URI partially matches the given baseURI. For instance, if the base URI would be http://mydomain/foo.owl and the ontology contains a service http://mydomain/foo.owl#MyService the method would return this service because both URIs partially match (except for the fragment). If several instances exist it picks one arbitrarily.

This method delegates to the corresponding method of the associated reader.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
OWLReader.read(Reader, URI)

readAllServices

OWLIndividualList<Service> readAllServices(java.net.URI uri)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
Convenience method to read an ontology into this KB from the given physical URI and to query for OWL-S service individuals. More precisely, the method searches the ontology resource including imported ontologies (if any) for OWL-S Service individuals.

This method delegates to the corresponding method of the associated reader.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
See Also:
OWLReader.read(URI)
